project.teaser: Traditionally, a robot is a machine controlled by a central unit and used to perform specific tasks automatically, often in a structured environment. MAPWORMS aims at challenging this traditional concept by proposing robots inspired by simplified forms of Marine Annelida, able...
project.objective: Traditionally, a robot is a machine controlled by a central unit and used to perform specific tasks automatically, often in a structured environment. MAPWORMS aims at challenging this traditional concept by proposing robots inspired by simplified forms of Marine Annelida, able to performtasks in response to environmental stimuli and to adapt to the environment with a shape-morphing strategy. Smart shape-memory hydrogels, able to respond to different stimuli (ion species, chemicals, light, pH, etc.), represent the building blocks in this new generation of morphing robots. By combining smart reactive hydrogels with nonreactive elements, actuation units able to transduce stiffness variation into geometrical changes will be developed. In the proposed endeavour, biology is the inspiration for simplifying principles to deal with a complex world, material science is the foundation for giving the body its proper role in shaping behaviour, mathematical modelling is the way to describe biological mechanisms to provide hints and laws for the artificial counterpart. Robotics and engineering aim at providing tools to quantitatively and functionally study biology, to bring innovative materials from chemistry labs to working systems, and to provide general purpose actuators and adapting machines. With a team of 6 partners (including 2 SMEs) in 4 years, MAPWORMS intends to: 1) study adaptation and plasticity of the body plan in Marine Annelida and shed light on the specialization process that allowed forms appeared early in the evolution of the Phylum to adapt to different environments; 2) develop a mathematical model of Annelida plasticity and adaptation to the environment through burrowing, protrusion of parts of their bodies, and morphological changes; 3) develop smart soft materials embodying responsivity, shape morphing and self-healing capabilities, and based on DNA components; 4) develop bio-inspired modular shape morphing robots across the scale.
project.title: Mimicking Adaptation and Plasticity in WORMS
project.keywords: shape-morphing robots, soft materials, DNA-based hydrogels, biomimetics, adaptation and plasticity, animal behaviour

article.title: From marine worms to shape-morphing soft robots

result.title: First set of parameters for modelling
result.description: Annelida quantitative study in terms of burrowing, shape-morphing, species anatomy and morphology will lead to gather a data set supporting shape morphing modelling. All these data will be collected and organized in this deliverable.

result.title: Towards a new standard for marine annelid checklists: the Salento Peninsula as a case study

result.title: Georeferenced Annelida distribution map along the Apulia coast
result.description: In this report CoNISMa will draw an Anellida distribution map along the Apulia coast In particular the identified hard and soft bottom marine habitats along the Salento coast more suitable for the collection of selected Annelida species will be described

result.title: Website and Project LOGO
result.description: A dedicated website will be designed and properly implemented for public communication A project LOGO will be defined and properly used for project comunication and dissemination purposes

result.title: First version of actuation units combination
result.description: SSSA will report on how reversibly combine actuation units towards the development of morphing robots with an approach viable at different size. The exploitation of the self-healing properties of the stimuli-responsive hydrogel to enable this combination will be described in detail.

result.title: Dissemination, communication and exploitation plan
result.description: Planned dissemination communication and exploiatation actions will be here described starting from the poposal information and properly updating them This deliverable represents a guidance for the entire project activities

result.teaser: Traditional robots, controlled by a central unit, are built for specific tasks in structured environments. The MAPWORMS project challenges this paradigm by developing soft robots inspired by marine worms, capable of mechano-morphing and adapting to environmental stimuli...

result.title: FAIR-compliant Data Management Plan
result.description: The Data Manager DM will take care of the design and update of a Data Management Plan DMP which will be delivered in the form of a report In this document the DM will define the protocols and policies to inform and guide researchers in properly managing their data and software The DMP will follow all the technical activities The DMP will define strict protocols in handling and transferring data during the project For this purpose the organization of several Data Management Team meetings among the different partners is crucial through which the data delivery and standardisations will be discussed and finalised The DMP will follow FAIR Data Principles

result.title: First working actuation unit
result.description: In this deliverable we will describe actuation units structure (constitutive materials, multilayered layout) and working principle (devised triggering stimuli).

result.title: Annual report on key communication events
result.description: This deliverable will be submitted at the end of the first year to present the key communication events involving the ConsortiumEach partner will contribute to the report by describing the activities undertaken to transfer project results to the widest audience both general public and scientifictechnicalindustrial communities

result.title: Mimicking Adaptation and Plasticity in WORMS: the MAPWORMS Project

details.authors: Linda Paternò; Ilaria Cedrola; Hasan Dad Ansari Mohammad; Veronica Iacovacci; Selene Tognarelli; Arianna Menciassi

result.title: Validated direct morphing FEM algorithm
result.description: In this report, SSSA will describe the developed FEM algorithm enabling to calculate evolving shapes of structures made of stimuli-responsive hydrogels. The algorithm will be applied to real Annelida-inspired morphing problems and validated by studying living and synthetic configurations.

result.title: Delivery of available smart responsive hydrogels for preliminary modelling and for devising integration possibilities
result.description: HUJI will develop and optimize novel hydrogel formulations featured by responsivity to redox signals electrochemical or oxidationreduction agents as stimuli photochemical stimuli using hydrogels modified with photoisomerizable units thermoplamonic nanoparticlesnanorods and chemicalmetabolite agents Information on these formulations and on their features will be summarized in this report and represent a starting point to devise modeling and integration strategies

result.title: Applying Fair principles to micro-CT data, the case of MAPWORMS project

details.journalTitle: 5th International Congress on Applied Ichthyology, Oceanography, and Aquatic Environment

result.title: RP2 update of the Data Management Plan
result.description: The Data Manager (DM) will take care of the design and update of a Data Management Plan (DMP), which will be delivered in the form of a report. In this document, the DM will define the protocols and policies to inform and guide researchers in properly managing their data (and software). The DMP will follow all the technical activities. The DMP will define strict protocols in handling and transferring data during the project. For this purpose, the organization of several Data Management Team meetings among the different partners is crucial, through which the data delivery and standardisations will be discussed and finalised.The DMP will follow FAIR Data Principles and will be updated in the framework of the second reporting period of the project.

category.title: sustainability sciences
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/environmental sciences/sustainability sciences

category.title: soft robotics

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
